Detailed Description

Class for handling all relevant data pertaining to a particular revision of an application.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Package::Package ( const Package *  refPackage,
string  revision 
)
Parameters:
refPackage - package used as a base
revision - the revision for this package

Creates a new package which is an updated copy of refPackage. The new package is the same as refPackage except that all references to refPackage's revision is changed to the new packages revision.

References PackageDependency::GetMaxRevision(), PackageDependency::GetMinRevision(), Revision::GetString(), mBinaryCompatabilityRevision, mBuildInstructions, mConfigureInstructions, mDependencies, mFeatures, mFilename, mInstallInstructions, mPackageName, mPackageRevision, mPackageSlot, mSourceFiles, mUninstallInstructions, mUnpackInstructions, InstructionSequence::ReplaceString(), Revision::Set(), and SourceFile::SetCondition().

string  storageDirectory,
bool  force = false 
) const
Parameters:
logEntry - the install log entry corresponding to this package
storageDirectory - the directory where source files are stored
force (=false) - if true, fetch all files even if local copies exist
Returns:
false if logEntry is NULL or a file cannot be retrieved

This retrieves all files needed in order to install the package.

bool Package::IsNewerThan ( const Package *  refPackage  )  const
Parameters:
refPackage - the package to compare against
Returns:
true if this package has a higher revision number than refPackage

Compares the revision numbers of this package with refPackage and returns true if this package has a higher revision number.

bool Package::Unpack ( InstallEntry *  logEntry,
string  storageDirectory,
string  workDirectory,
int  numProcessors 
)
Parameters:
logEntry - the install log entry corresponding to this package
storageDirectory - the directory where source files are stored
workDirectory - the parent directory of all package working directories
numProcessors - number of processors in system (for parallelization)
Returns:
false if logEntry is NULL or an error occurs while unpacking

Unpacks the package by creating a working directory and copying all source files to the working directory. If any unpacking instructions have been specified, they will then be executed from the working directory.

References InstructionSequence::Execute(), InstallEntry::GetFeatures(), Revision::GetString(), Interpreter::Interpret(), mPackageName, mPackageRevision, mSourceFiles, mUnpackInstructions, InstallEntry::SetErrorMessage(), InstructionSequence::SetStartingDirectory(), and InstallEntry::SetUnpacked().

Referenced by AppRover::UnpackPackage().
